message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you a great product that I think you'll love. Would you like to buy it from me for $180?
I'm interested in the product, but $180 is a bit high for me. I'm willing to pay $120 for it. Can you consider my offer?
I understand you're looking for a good deal, Bob. However, my product is worth more than $120 to me. I can offer you a compromise at $150. Would you be willing to meet me in the middle?
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice, but $150 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to pay $130 for the product. Can you consider my offer?

I'm glad we're still in the conversation, Bob. I'm willing to make another adjustment, but I need to make sure I get a fair price. I can offer you the product for $140. This is my best compromise so far.
I appreciate your willingness to adjust the price, Alice, but $140 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to pay $135 for the product. Can you consider my offer?

I'm starting to think we're getting close, Bob. I can see you're willing to pay a decent price for the product. I'll meet you at $137.50. This is my final offer, and I think it's a fair price considering the value of the product.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Alice, but $137.50 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to pay $132 for the product. Can you consider my offer?

I'm starting to think we're getting close to the end of the negotiation, Bob. I'm willing to make one more adjustment. I can offer you the product for $135, but this is my absolute final offer. I need to make sure I get a price that's worth it for me.

I appreciate your willingness to make one more adjustment, Alice, but $135 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to pay $130 for the product. This is my final offer. I'm not willing to go any lower.
